Bud Sharon Miller Ramon Villamil Gene vieve Lohmuller Gloria Gordon Becky Biber stein Fern Britton James Yonker Sr Eve lyn Morrissey Betty Meyer Ron Payne David Carr Ronnie Bonnie Burns Michael Green Dorothy Dottie Marbach and Rick Cotterman 25TH SUNDAY IN ORDINARY TIME SEPTEMBER 24 2017 YR GODS WAYS ARE NOT OUR WAYS HE IS ALWAYS GENEROUS My dear brothers and sisters in Christ I say peace be with you all Today Sept 24 is the PLEDGE SUNDAY We shall watch the Bishops Appeal Video Please do you best to participate Let us try to have 100 participation this time We did well last year I hope we will do better this year Thanks in advance for participating and giving generously In todays Liturgy we are assured that God is always compassionate to all us both those who are quick to hear his voice and those who are slow to hear his voice It seems that in our world today material things especially money is much cherished in value Doing something or not doing it seems to depend on the amount of money that goes with it Even what some students choose as their course as their major subject study in schools colleges and univer sities depend on what will be cashed remuneration in money tomorrow However there seem to be some truth in this kind Philosophy and ideology But there is some misconception in this If we apply this ideology to God it would mean that God is owing us something call it sal vation after we have done some good works It is true that the bible speaks of reward but focusing all attention on this aspect alone would result in the immature attitude of a child who thinks that his father owes himher money for every little work heshe does in the house Our main reason for serving God should be love and gratitude and not merely reward for God does not owe us anything no matter what work we do So in the 1st Reading Is 5569 The Israelites in Babylon were felt that their exile was punishment from God for their sins They deserved it But Prophet Isaiah promised them freedom Was the promised freedom due to good works of the people Off course no It was due to Gods generosity For God does not owe anybody anything The 2nd Reading Phil 120c24 27a Was written by Paul to the Philippians when he was in prison in Ephesus the present Turkey It is important that we should take Pauls ad vice and behave like people who are worthy of the Gospel of Christ For if we live we be long to Christ if we die we are his So we should conduct ourselves in a way worthy of the Gospel of Christ for God is always near to those who call upon him says the Psalmist In the Gospel Mt 20116a We realized Gods generosity and love Our reward does not solely depend on our works We need to work do well and be kind to others but our reward does not solely depend on them The laborers who worked for 12 hours received one denarius each but those who worked for one hour only also received one denarius each You can see that their pay does not depend on the amount of work they did It depends on the decision love and generosity of the Landowner Gods ways are not our ways Our duty is to strive to do well and leave reward to God for he is a just God Children and young people listen to your parents serve them and never demand reward for whatever you do for them They know what is good for you and they will do it for you God bless you Rev Msgr Pius Ilechukwu NB 1 We are organizing Marriage Encounter Parish Based Please register quickly 2 We are also planning a Pilgrimage to the Holy Land to join in the Foot Steps of Jesus Christ It is from April 23 to May 2 2018 Thanks to Ja.net Lehman and Stacey Coulardot for coordinating this The Brochure is now available Pick up one at the Narthex read and register For more information and guidance contact Ja.net Lehman (260)824-0367 or Stacey Coulardot (260)466-1224 or Parish Office at (260)824-1380 3 Redeemer Radio is one of the most powerful means of spreading the good of the Gospel of Our Lord Jesus Christ It helps greatly to fulfill the mandate of spreading the Gospel through New Evangelization Any time you tune in to Redeemer Radio you will learn something new or you are reminded of something you have forgotten It is amazing Our Bishop Most Rev Kevin Rhoades teaches through the Redeemer Radio every Wednesday by noon It also hooks to EWTN Radio and Television Listen to Redeemer Radio while you prepare your meals in the Kitchen while shaving or doing something in your house while driving to work etc Thus to continue to spread the Gospel of Jesus Christ through Redeemer Radio it organizes SHARATHON Fund Raiser in Spring and Fall thus inviting parishes to participate In view of this Msgr Pius Ilechukwu and the Knights of Columbus will chair One Hour of SHARATHONFund Raiser for Redeemer Radio on October 26 from 6:00pm to 7:00pm on behalf of our parish Every Parishioner is encour aged to participate by calling and supporting the SHARATHONFund Raiser Give any kind of support you wish No amount is too small or too big Tunein to1063 FM Northeast Indiana or 957 FM Michiana for South Bend area and call on that day and support the spreading of the Good News of the Kingdom of God Thanks for support ing God bless you and all your loved ones The amount needed each week to make budget is 511640 We are 99475 behind budget from last week Other Collections within our Parish St Vincent de Paul 16000 30th ABA Over Goal 42389 Diocesan Collection Campaign for Human Develop ment 1500 Special Coll Hurricane Harvey 160800 Collection for Weekend of September 16 and 17 2017 Adult Envelopes 333500 Child Envelopes 4665 Loose 24900 DAR Do you like to travel Have you considered a trip to the Holy Land St Jo seph Church Pilgrimage to the Holy Land Please pick up a detailed travel brochure available in the church narthex that explains everything this trip has to offer 10 Days Package Price from Ft Wayne IN 359000 OR from Detroit MI 329000 Departure Date April 23 2018 May 2 2018 Package price includes Roundtrip airfare Double occupancy accommodations with breakfast and dinner daily Sightseeing in private air conditioned bus Entrance fees to places of interests while on this tour in the Holy Land Daily Mass ALPHA The first Alpha at St Josephs has met the past two Friday evenings Discussion topics were ls there more to life than this and who is Jesus Next session is why did Jesus die We meet on Friday eve nings and share a meal as well If you are interested in joining us or finding out more please call George Wit wer at (260)824-4503 or Barb Ault at 260 4143605 so that we can share times and get food counts You can read more at alphausa.org 40 DAYS FOR LIFE 40 Days for Life begins September 27 November 5 There will be yard signs available in the Narthex that you may take home and place in your yard This is a time of prayer fast ing peaceful vigils and community outreach St Joseph church will be taking part in a peaceful prayerful vigil located at Park West shopping center at 3942 Jefferson in the southern grassy area in front of Planned Parenthood from 600PM 800PM on Thursday October 12 Anyone interested in going may join our carpool which will be leaving the church parking lot at 500PM Also you are welcome to drop in at any time on your own that evening You may park in the Burlington Coat Factory parking lot and walk over from there You are welcome to bring chairs to sit in and the 40 Days for Life signs to hold if you wish For more information on 40 Days for Life go to wwwichooselifeorg40daysforlife Any questions may be directed to Mike Lautzenheiser at 8200316 or Debbie Lautzen heiser at 8200315 This is a great opportunity to stand up for the vulnerable unborn REDEEMER RADIO 1063FM Redeemer Radio began in 2002 with the purchase of weekly airtime on a local commercial radio station to broadcast Catholic Answers Live and has since grown into a 24hour a day seven day a week local Catholic radio station reaching thousands of people in northern Indiana They have a fundraiser SHARATHON each spring and fall invit ing parishes to participate This fall Msgr Pius Ilechukwu and the Knights of Columbus will chair one hour of the SHARATHON Fundraiser on Thursday October 26 from 600700 pm on behalf of our parish Every parishioner is encouraged to participate by call ing and supporting the fundraiser no amount is too small or too big Thank you for your support DONT FORGET If you wish to receive a paper copy of Todays Catholic Newspaper you may still do so this week as the deadline is October 1st Make checks payable to Todays Catholic for 20 Envelopes were available in the narthex in
